Finding aid created by

did.abstract: Professor of law at the University of Michigan and member of the University's Board in Control of Intercollegiate Athletics. Papers include files relating to his involvement in university athletics, notably as the faculty representative to the Big Ten Conference, as member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA), and member of the U. S. Olympic Committee; also materials concerning university hockey, especially the Western Intercollegiate Hockey Association; also photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: The collection (donor number 6768) came to the library in April 1982.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Marcus L. Plant Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Marcus L. Plant was born in New London, Wisconsin, on November 10, 1911. He received his BA (1932) and MA (1934) from Lawrence College and his JD (1938) from the University of Michigan. He entered a private law firm in Milwaukee (1938-1844) and then in New York City (1944-1946) before becoming a member of the law faculty of the University of Michigan. Plant was a member of the faculty from 1946 until his retirement in 1982

While at the University of Michigan, Plant developed strong ties to Michigan's Athletic Department, the Big Ten Conference, and various regional and national associations representing amateur athletics. At the University of Michigan he was a member of the Board in Control of Intercollegiate Athletics (1949-1979) and served as Michigan's Faculty Representative to the Big Ten Conference (1955-1979). He was secretary of the Big Ten faculty representatives from 1956 to 1979. A member of the NCAA since 1955, Plant served as the NCAA's President from 1967 to 1969 and as a member of the Executive Committee from 1970 to 1979. In addition, Plant was a member of the United States Olympic Committee from 1969 to 1972

scopecontent.p: The papers are arranged according to the filing system developed by Plant. The six major series of his records include Athletics at the University of Michigan; Big Ten Conference; National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA); Western Intercollegiate Hockey League; Western Collegiate Hockey Association; and United States Olympic Committee.

scopecontent.p: The records relating to athletics at the University of Michigan consist of Plant's files during the years he was a member of the Board in Control of Intercollegiate Athletics (1949-1979). These files include annual reports and minutes of the Board in Control of Intercollegiate Athletics; correspondence with University of Michigan Presidents Harlan Hatcher and Robben Fleming and with the Senate Advisory Committee on University Affairs; and records relating to scholastic eligibility of student-athletes at the University.

did.unittitle: Board in Control of Intercollegiate Athletics
Michigan Calendar Problems in the Big Ten
Senate Advisory Committee on University Affairs (SAC)
Transfers: Cross Campus LSA and School of Education
University of Michigan Ann Arbor Alumni Club-Summer Employment

scopecontent.p: The records of the Big Ten Conference were collected by Plant during his tenure as the University of Michigan's faculty representative to the Big Ten (1955-1979). These records include correspondence and minutes of the Council of Ten (the ten university presidents); recommendations and decisions concerning financial aid plans; interpretations and opinions of Conference rules and regulations; and records relating to women's athletics.

did.unittitle: Report of the Commissioner to the Council of Ten
Financial Aid Plans in the Big Ten
Handbook of the Intercollegiate (Big Ten) Conference 1979
Interpretations and Opinions of Conference Rules; Regulations and Agreements; and Procedures Memorandum 1965-1975

scopecontent.p: The records of the NCAA (1961 to 1980) are particularly complete during Plant's NCAA presidential term, 1967 to 1969. The files contain materials on the NCAA-AAU controversy, correspondence, Executive committee minutes, minutes of the NCAA Council, and topical files.

did.unittitle: Report: The Track and Field Rebellion
NCAA v. Howard Porter and the ABA
Special Committee on Canadian Hockey Players
Legal Attaches on Rulings on Student Eligibility
Profession Football Telecasts in Violation of PL87-331
Track and Field Lawsuit (Samara v. NCAA)
Congressional Investigation of NCAA Infraction Procedures
Proposal for Need and Number Limitations on Grants of Financial Aid
Television Revenue: Long Beach State Proposal 1975

scopecontent.p: The records of the Western Intercollegiate Hockey League include the history and minutes of the league, correspondence, and materials concerning Canadian students' eligibility.

Western Collegiate Hockey Association (WCHA) records consist of organizational papers, correspondence and papers concerning the WCHA realignment, and the NCAA's investigation of the Midwest Junior Hockey League.

The materials of the United States Olympic Committee were collected by Plant while he was a member of the Committee (1969-1972). The records consist of administrative files; and papers relating to the Committee for a Better Olympics, the Committee on Eligibility Olympic Committee matters, and the President's Commission on Olympic Sports.

did.unittitle: United States Track and Field Federation
Centennial Observance of the law School of the University of Michigan 1959

scopecontent.p: The Photographs series includes images from ceremonies relating to celebration of the centennial of the University of Michigan Law School; photos of faculty used in centennial observance publications; and miscellaneous photos of Plant at meetings.
